2.text: Hear diligently my speech; and let this be your consolations.

3.text: Suffer me, and I also will speak; and after that I have spoken, mock on.

4.text: As for me, is my complaint to man? and why should I not be impatient?

5.text: Mark me, and be astonished, and lay your hand upon your mouth.

6.text: Even when I remember I am troubled, and horror taketh hold on my flesh.

7.text: Wherefore do the wicked live, become old, yea, wax mighty in power?

8.text: Their seed is established with them in their sight, and their offspring before their eyes.

9.text: Their houses are safe from fear, neither is the rod of God upon them.

10.text: Their bull gendereth, and faileth not; their cow calveth, and casteth not her calf.

11.text: They send forth their little ones like a flock, and their children dance.

12.text: They sing to the timbrel and harp, and rejoice at the sound of the pipe.

13.text: They spend their days in prosperity, and in a moment they go down to Sheol.

14.text: Yet they said unto God, Depart from us; for we desire not the knowledge of thy ways.

15.text: What is the Almighty, that we should serve him? and what profit should we have, if we pray unto him?

16.text: Lo, their prosperity is not in their hand: the counsel of the wicked is far from me.

17.text: How oft is it that the lamp of the wicked is put out? that their calamity cometh upon them? that God distributeth sorrows in his anger?

18.text: That they are as stubble before the wind, and as chaff that the storm carrieth away?

19.text: Ye say, God layeth up his iniquity for his children. Let him recompense it unto himself, that he may know it.

20.text: Let his own eyes see his destruction, and let him drink of the wrath of the Almighty.

21.text: For what pleasure hath he in his house after him, when the number of his months is cut off in the midst?

22.text: Shall any teach God knowledge? seeing he judgeth those that are high.

23.text: One dieth in his full strength, being wholly at ease and quiet:

24.text: His breasts are full of milk, and the marrow of his bones is moistened.

25.text: And another dieth in bitterness of soul, and never tasteth of good.

26.text: They lie down alike in the dust, and the worm covereth them.

27.text: Behold, I know your thoughts, and the devices which ye wrongfully imagine against me.

28.text: For ye say, Where is the house of the prince? and where is the tent wherein the wicked dwelt?

29.text: Have ye not asked them that go by the way? and do ye not know their tokens?

30.text: That the evil man is reserved to the day of calamity? that they are led forth to the day of wrath?

31.text: Who shall declare his way to his face? and who shall repay him what he hath done?

32.text: Yet shall he be borne to the grave, and shall keep watch over the tomb.

33.text: The clods of the valley shall be sweet unto him, and all men shall draw after him, as there were innumerable before him.

34.text: How then comfort ye me in vain, seeing in your answers there remaineth only falsehood?
